places_with_reviews.name: Kasar Devi Temple Almora
places_with_reviews.address: Binsar Rd, Kasardevi, JMR6+PP7, Mat, Uttarakhand 263601, India

reviews.text: I couldn't found better rating so I gave it 5 star rating very humble. This quiet place is in Almora. It is place where Swami Vivekananda meditated. It is very peaceful . One can have very nice sunrise and sunset view from here.

There's a saying about this place that it's believed to be located on the Earth's Van Allen Belt( a huge lectromagnetic field ). The place surely has some extremely strong and positive aura. You can have the best view of both sunrise and the sunset here. People come for meditation and yoga, and even after spending hours in silence, you won't get even a bit bored here !

This temple is famously known as the only three places on this planet under the impact of highly charged geomagnetic fields that come within the Van Allen Belts discovered by NASA. Nestled on a hilltop stands the devi and shiva temple. One can view the entire town from the temple, it’s best to take a seat on the rocks and enjoy the peace and feel the power of the magnificent energy. There is plenty of space to meditate. There are many other tales of swami Vivekanand & Devi maa as well. The temple is said to be over 2000 yrs old.

Must visited place, Because there are only two or three such places in the whole world where magnetic fields are found, these places are the best places to meditate, there is a lot of calm and positive energy here.

Peaceful place. Best place for meditation. I personally felt really energetic after siting here for sometime. And do not miss the sunset here.  To reach the shiva temple on top , it’s around 30-50 steps to climb.

Beware of monkeys

places_with_reviews.name: Chitai Golu Devta Temple
places_with_reviews.address: Chitai, SH 37, Almora, Kuchar, Uttarakhand 263601, India

reviews.text: Here he is worshipped as God of justice, and believed that he rides the area on his white horse. People put write there issue’s on paper and hung here, once there wish is fulfilled then people hung bells here. When u visit this please u see so many bells here.

We were very blessed to visit this temple of Golu Ji Maharaja. There are many temples of Golu Devta; however, this one is the main temple, where a lot of devotees come every day throughout the year. Golu Devata is known for giving fair judgement in any conflict, dispute, or court case (as people believe). When you visit there, you can write down your personal issue or conflict on paper and tie it there with a bell. 🔔.
Beware of the monkeys there; while entering the temple or standing in queue, they snatch the prasadam or things. One should visit this place while in Almora.

God of mountains. It's also known as Bell temple. You will see lot of bells hanging in temple. Devotees put bells after completing there wishes.

Holy place.

The extent of belief extended by the people is amazingly awesome .
People write out petitions requesting for divine intervention and hang it all around the temple premises , once fulfilled they donate bells to the Devta in gratitude .
It is a pleasant sight to see the premises covered with bells of various sizes.
As long as there is no violence and hatred, any kind of belief is fine .

I regularly visit Golu ji , I always get peace and feel blessed , you can offer a bell , you will see thousands of bells and letters of request to the Golu ji
Must visit place !

Good place to visit

So beautiful so elegant just looking like a wow. .
Very good place to visit such a good place for mountain lover.

**Almora, Uttarakhand: A Himalayan Gem of Cultural Richness and Scenic Beauty**

Nestled in the Kumaon region of Uttarakhand, Almora stands as a testament to the harmonious blend of cultural heritage and breathtaking landscapes. Here's an in-depth review to guide you through the allure of this Himalayan town.

**Cultural Heritage:**
Almora, with its rich history dating back to the Chand dynasty, is a cultural treasure trove. The town is adorned with ancient temples, including the revered Nanda Devi Temple and Kasar Devi Temple. The intricately carved architecture and spiritual ambiance make these sites not only religiously significant but also fascinating for history enthusiasts.

**Scenic Beauty and Panoramic Views:**
Perched at an altitude of approximately 1,651 meters (5,417 feet) above sea level, Almora offers panoramic views of the surrounding Himalayan peaks. The town is situated atop a ridge, providing breathtaking vistas of snow-capped mountains, including Trishul and Nanda Devi. The Mall Road and Zero Point are popular vantage points offering spectacular views of the landscape.

**Best Time to Visit:**
The ideal time to visit Almora is during the spring and summer months, from March to June, when the weather is pleasant, and the flora is in full bloom. This period allows for comfortable exploration of the town and its surroundings. Monsoons (July to September) bring lush greenery but also occasional rainfall, while winter (December to February) offers a serene experience with chilly temperatures.

**Local Markets and Cuisine:**
Almora's local markets, such as Lala Bazaar and Mall Road, offer a delightful shopping experience with traditional Kumaoni handicrafts and unique local products. The town's cuisine, featuring local dishes like Bhaang ki Khatai and Singal, provides a gastronomic journey into the flavors of Kumaon.

**Cultural Festivals:**
Almora hosts various cultural festivals that showcase the vibrant traditions of the region. The Nanda Devi Mela is a significant event, celebrated with much fervor, drawing both locals and tourists to participate in the cultural extravaganza.

**Accommodation Options:**
Almora provides a range of accommodation options, from heritage hotels to budget-friendly guesthouses. Many establishments offer panoramic views of the mountains, providing a comfortable and immersive stay in the lap of the Himalayas.

In conclusion, Almora, with its cultural richness, scenic beauty, and Himalayan charm, offers a captivating retreat for travelers seeking a perfect blend of history and nature. Whether you're a culture enthusiast, nature lover, or someone in search of tranquility, Almora unfolds its charms in every corner, promising a memorable journey into the heart of the Kumaon Himalayas.
Best city in Uttarakhand state for travelling and exploring new things I must say that at least one time in life you have to visit Almora district ✨❤️👍🤍

Beauty, beauty and beauty. Though the place has now become crowded, but still you get some of the mind blowing views from this place.
My recommendation would be to surely go to Vridh Jageshwar and Jageshwar Dham. These places have unmatched beauty. The old temples are just heart thumping as if Lord Shiva is really watching you from somewhere.

places_with_reviews.name: Katarmal Sun Temple
places_with_reviews.address: Sun tempal katarmal, Almora, Adheli Sunar, Uttarakhand 263601, India

reviews.text:
There are only 2 sun temples in Bharat, and Karatmal is one of them,
Few miles away from almora district this place has its own magnificent history and aura.

The temple itself, steeped in history, exudes an aura of ancient grandeur. Though not imposing in size, it captivates visitors with its timeless beauty, showcasing weathered stones and intricate details that tell stories of a bygone era. The view from this vantage point is nothing short of breathtaking, offering a glimpse of the past and the natural beauty of the surroundings.

To make your visit even more comfortable, there are drinking water taps available to quench your thirst after your exploration. If you find yourself in Uttarakhand, this unique destination is a must-visit, granting you the privilege of witnessing the one and only second sun temple in all of India.

A must visit place.
The only Sun temple on the world where everyday Pooja is being performed and God Sun is in “Padmasan” with all their Ganas.
This temple is believed to be from Tretayug by locals and Katyuri rulers have renovated it in 9th century with marvellous architecture.
This is an amazing place with most ancient arts carved on the stones and idols.
This temple is situated along Almora -Ranikhet Highway not too far from Almora, around 18 KM (45 mins due to hilly road)
You’ll have to track uphill by around 10-12 mins and you’ll reach.

The way to the temple is so beautiful and the view is just mesmerising. It’s a very old and beautiful temple. A very quiet place to sit, relax, pray and meditate. Specially like the Dhoop smell surrounded by the entire temple prangan.

Such a peaceful and serene place. Must visit. Important Info- there is a parking on the way, don’t park there as it is a long walk from there. You can park just 50meters below the temple, just follow the road and you’ll see the last point on the road.

Over eight centuries old, this intricately carved temple in Almora is set amid the jaw-dropping vistas and deodar forests of the Kumaon hills. This ancient structure dedicated to the sun god is one of the foremost temples of its kind. Despite its age, it continues to be the spiritual centre of this village and an important site of worship that brings in devotees from across the country especially during the annual Chhath Puja celebrations.

places_with_reviews.name: Balta waterfall
places_with_reviews.address: JMVJ+5VG, Unnamed Road, Balta, Bintola Malla, Uttarakhand 263601, India

reviews.text:
The waterfall is all dried up, ask the locals before going the there, gather full information if the waterfall is running or not. It was a bit tricky to find the fall, trail is beautiful tho. There’s around 1.5 km hike to the waterfall, wear full clothes because there are some poisonous plants on the way and they will make you itch a lot.
Locals were taking a dip in the still water, and it wasn’t were clean.

It's a hidden gem amidst the jungle and valley of kasar devi.

It's about 8 kms from papersailley or the kasar devi road. Then you'll have to park vehicle road side.

It's a serene hike of about 2 kms. Not recommended for senior citizens. The route to reach the waterfall is a bit tricky.

But once you reach, it's absolutely mesmerising and the solace will give you relief.

Must visit. Kindly don't litter. Cheeeeeers 🍺

Keep this hidden and clean first of all.
This place a nature’s paradise with beautiful waterfall and lagoons around.
The hike here is short and beautiful.
I visited here twice but the fresh water, beautiful sunshine and clean green area makes this a paradise to chill.

Balta waterfall is hidden by pine and deodar trees in the middle of a lush green dense forest. As you drive to the spot from where you must go on foot, be careful as the road is bad. While it is a steep hike from the road, it is worth a visit. You walk through a scenic jungle trail,
surrounded by mountains. Carry your own water, wear caps, and plenty of sunscreen. Locals warn you of leopard sightings even during the day at the waterfall, so it is advisable to go in a group. Both the path and the place are deserted. When you reach, the view is simply amazing! In the Monsoons, its gorgeous! Be careful with selfies though, people have slipped, and the water is freezing. Once done, do take all your garbage as you leave. Let us keep Balta waterfall pure and pristine.

To reach Balta waterfall, you can drive to the village of Balta and then hike for about 1.5 kilometers. The hike is relatively easy, and it takes you through a scenic forest trail. Once you reach the waterfall, you will be rewarded with stunning views of the cascading water and the surrounding mountains.

Balta waterfall is a great place to relax and enjoy the beauty of nature. If you are looking for a peaceful and scenic spot to spend a day, then Balta waterfall is the perfect place for you.
